intro: Ornithogalum gracilentum, commonly known as the slender star-of-Bethlehem, is a bulbous plant native to southern Africa. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of white, star-shaped flowers during the spring and summer seasons. The plant is part of the Asparagaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders. Its elegant appearance and relatively low maintenance make it a popular choice among gardeners.
